versions.title: Type of Note
versions.notes: This vocabulary was first published by the DDI Alliance. Please see: https://ddialliance.org/controlled-vocabularies/all.
versions.citation: DDI Alliance. (2020). Type of Note (Version 1.0) [Controlled vocabulary]. CESSDA. urn:ddi:int.ddi.cv:TypeOfNote:1.0.
versions.ddiUsage:
DDI 3.2
Module name: reusable
Element name: TypeOfNote

DDI 2.5
Element/Attribute name: notes@type

concepts.title: Processing Note
concepts.definition: A note related to the processing of the data, or metadata, or both.

concepts.title: Addendum
concepts.definition: Additional information, usually of a factual nature (as opposed to a comment), intended to clarify the content of a DDI section or module.

concepts.title: System Note
concepts.definition: A note generated by the processing system used to produce the data, or metadata, or both.

concepts.title: Observation
concepts.definition: A note providing information on an aspect relevant for data usage that is likely to remain permanent, or a temporary note providing information for further review and correction. May be an observation entered by a human user or a system-generated note on any inconsistencies or deviations.

concepts.title: Comment
concepts.definition: A human-readable comment, typically of a more subjective nature than an addendum.

concepts.title: Other
concepts.definition: Use when the type of note is known, but not found in the list.
